alert.note: Alert for Camden; Chowan; Eastern Currituck; Gates; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 5:14PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CAMDEN...PASQUOTANK...NORTHERN PERQUIMANS...EASTERN GATES...CURRITUCK AND NORTHWESTERN CHOWAN COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM EDT... At 514 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of South Mills to 6 miles west of Morgans Corner to Tyner. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hertford, Winfall, South Mills, Morgans Corner, and Belvidere around 520 PM EDT. Elizabeth City and Chapanoke around 530 PM EDT. Moyock around 535 PM EDT. Camden and Elizabeth City State University around 540 PM EDT. Whitehall Shores and Nixonton around 545 PM EDT. Currituck around 550 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Bob White Fork, Gliden, Horseshoe, Pierceville, Arrowhead Beach, Peach, Parkville, Tar Corner, Nicanor, and Gregory. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina...and southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Camden; Chowan; Eastern Currituck; Gates; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck
